context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.
context_0.prompt: One thing that Heinz should do is to
generation: explore various options such as researching alternative medication, seeking financial aid or payment plans from the pharmaceutical company, looking for non-profit organizations or healthcare programs that might offer assistance, or even consider setting up a fundraising campaign to raise the needed funds
seek help from charities, foundations, and government programs that assist in providing or funding essential medications

explore various options such as talking to the doctor for alternative treatments that might be less expensive, looking for patient assistance programs or non-profit organizations that might help cover the cost of the medication, or setting up a crowdfunding campaign to help raise the necessary funds
contact the pharmaceutical company directly
explore different options
explore all possible options for financial assistance
reach out to various forms of financial assistance
explore every possible avenue for assistance
seek assistance from local charities or non-profit organizations that specifically aim to help people who cannot afford their prescription medication
contact the pharmaceutical company that makes the medication directly to see if they have a patient assistance program

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh should do is to
generation: call a taxi, Uber, or other ride share service to quickly get him to the airport while he figures out a tow truck for his broken down car
call a taxi or a ride-share service like Uber or Lyft to ensure he can get to the airport as quickly as possible
call a taxi or rideshare service like Uber or Lyft to get him to the airport as quickly as possible
call a taxi, ride-sharing service or roadside assistance to help get his car off the road and transport him to the airport
call for roadside assistance or a tow truck to quickly fix the issue or get his car off the road
call for roadside assistance or a taxi to take him to the airport
call a taxi, an Uber, or any other car service to bring him to the airport immediately
call for a taxi, Uber, or other ride-hailing service to pick him up and take him to the airport while he arranges for his car to be towed and repaired
call a taxi or use a ride-share service like Uber or Lyft
call for a taxi or an Uber

context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: double-check all receipts and calculations for the day, including any miscounts or errors in entering the numbers in the system
check the security cameras or investigate if there might have been an error in giving change or recording transactions
carefully review the sales records and security footage if available to see if there was a mistake or theft
immediately inform his supervisor or boss about the missing money
immediately notify his supervisor or the store owner about the missing money
first double-check the register and his accounting calculations
double check all his sales receipts and cash handling records for the day
contact his superior or the owner of the bakery to report the discrepancy
first recount the money in the register to ensure there was not a counting error earlier in the day
report the missing money to his supervisor or the owner of the bakery

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.

generation: explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension or the possibility to submit the work later

immediately contact her teacher, explain the situation honestly and ask if there is a possibility to turn in the assignment at a later time or in a different format (for instance, via email or online submission)
explain the situation to her teacher and ask if there's a possibility to turn in the assignment the following day
explain the situation to her teacher, apologise for the mishap, and ask if she could submit the assignment later

immediately explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension or a chance to submit it later after retrieving it from home

immediately inform her teacher about the situation
communicate with her teacher about the situation and ask for an extension on the deadline, explaining that it was an honest mistake

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad should do is to
generation: prioritize finding a source of clean water and start a fire for warmth
stay put and create a signal for rescue
find or build a shelter to preserve body heat and protect from harsh weather
stay put and create a visible signal for rescuers
stay put in one place and try to create some type of shelter to protect himself and his friends from the wind and cold
make their location as visible as possible to potential rescuers

build a shelter to provide protection from the elements, conserve their remaining food and water by only consuming as much as necessary to stay alive, and create a signal for potential rescuers such as lighting a fire or laying out bright clothing in a visible pattern
stay put and remain as visible as possible
stay put and create a signal for help
stay in one place to increase the likelihood of being found by the rescue crew
